trans-unit.source: Factory that provides instances of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost"></xref> in managed hosting environments where the host instance is created dynamically in response to incoming messages.
The managed hosting environments that support dynamic activation are Internet Information Services (IIS) and Windows Process Activation Service (WAS).

If you have implemented a custom derivative of <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost>, consider also implementing a factory that derives from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activation.ServiceHostFactory> class.

If you have implemented a custom derivative of <xref:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase> instead, then consider also implementing a factory that derives your factory from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activation.ServiceHostFactoryBase> directly.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Activation.ServiceHostFactory"></xref> class.
Creates a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost"></xref> with specific base addresses and initializes it with specified data.
The initialization data passed to the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHostBase"></xref> instance being constructed by the factory.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that contains the base addresses for the service hosted.
There is no hosting context provided or constructorString is `null` or empty.
Creates a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost"></xref> for a specified type of service with a specific base address.
Specifies the type of service to host.
The <xref href="System.Array"></xref> of type <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that contains the base addresses for the service hosted.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost"></xref> for the type of service specified with a specific base address.
